head.title: World Briefing | Australia: Standing With U.S. On Warming Accord

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Australia: Standing With U.S. On Warming Accord

abstract.p: Prime Min John Howard of Australia tells Parliament he will continue to oppose climate treaty already ratified by Japan and European Union unless United States signs on; says he agrees with Pres Bush that pact would harm economy (S)

block.p: Despite ratification of a climate treaty by Japan and the European Union recently, Prime Minister John Howard of Australia told Parliament he would continue to oppose it unless the United States signed on. Last year President Bush rejected the treaty and has not wavered. If enacted, the treaty, the Kyoto Protocol, would require industrialized countries to cut emissions of heat-trapping greenhouse gases by 2012 below levels measured in 1990. Environmentalists are pressing Mr. Howard to embrace the pact, but -- echoing the views of Mr. Bush -- he says it would harm the economy.

Despite ratification of a climate treaty by Japan and the European Union recently, Prime Minister John Howard of Australia told Parliament he would continue to oppose it unless the United States signed on. Last year President Bush rejected the treaty and has not wavered. If enacted, the treaty, the Kyoto Protocol, would require industrialized countries to cut emissions of heat-trapping greenhouse gases by 2012 below levels measured in 1990. Environmentalists are pressing Mr. Howard to embrace the pact, but -- echoing the views of Mr. Bush -- he says it would harm the economy.
